alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Castle Country; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; San Rafael Swell; South Central Utah; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Canyonlands; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 3:12AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Castle Country, San Rafael Swell, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell, South Central Utah, Western Canyonlands, Lower Washington County and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Additionally, elevated potential exists for flash flooding and debris flows off of recent burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Castle Country; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; San Rafael Swell; South Central Utah; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Canyonlands; Zion National Park
